program main

   implicit none

   integer :: N, l, r, mid, target, i, j, n_str, M = 1000000007

   integer(kind=8) :: total, cnt, result1

   integer, allocatable :: arr(:), bit(:), dp(:,:)

   character(len=20) :: input_str

   ! Read first input

   read*, N

   allocate(arr(N))

   read*, arr

   ! Sort the array

   call sort(arr)

   total = N*(N+1)/2

   l = 1

   r = N

   do while (l < r)

      mid = (l + r)/2

      target = arr(mid)

      ! Initialize Fenwick Tree

      allocate(bit(2*N +2))

      bit = 0

      ! Initial loop

      integer :: x

      x = N +1

      do while (x <= 2*N +1)

         bit(x) = bit(x) +1

         x = x + iand(x, -x)

      end do

      cnt = 0

      integer :: cur =0

      do i =1, N

         if (arr(i) <= target) then

            cur = cur +1

         else

            cur = cur -1

         end if

         ! Update Fenwick Tree

         x = cur + N +1

         do while (x <= 2*N +1)

            bit(x) = bit(x) +1

            x = x + iand(x, -x)

         end do

         ! Query Fenwick Tree

         x = cur + N

         integer :: temp =0

         do while (x >0)

            temp = temp + bit(x)

            x = x - iand(x, -x)

         end do

         cnt = cnt + temp

      end do

      if (cnt >= (total/2 +1)) then

         r = mid

      else

         l = mid +1

      end if

      deallocate(bit)

   end do

   result1 = arr(l)

   ! Convert result1 to string

   write(input_str, '(I0)') result1

   n_str = len_trim(input_str)

   allocate(dp(0:n_str, 0:1))

   dp = 0

   dp(0,0) =1

   do i =1, n_str

      character(1) :: c = input_str(i:i)

      if (c == '0') then

         dp(i,0) = dp(i-1,0)

         dp(i,1) = dp(i-1,1)

      else

         dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i-1,0) + dp(i-1,1), M)

      end if

      if (c == '0') then

         dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i,1) + 2*dp(i-1,1), M)

      else

         dp(i,0) = mod(dp(i,0) + 2*dp(i-1,0), M)

         dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i,1) + 2*dp(i-1,1), M)

      end if

      dp(i,0) = mod(dp(i,0), M)

      dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i,1), M)

   end do

   print*, mod(dp(n_str,0) + dp(n_str,1), M)

end program main

In Fortran, the array is 1-based, so l starts at 1 and r at N. The binary search loop is correct.

Another possible issue is the calculation of mid:

In Java, mid = l + (r-l)/2. In Fortran, using integer division, (l + r)/2 is the same as Java's calculation.

Yes, because (l + r) is even or odd, but integer division in Fortran truncates, so (l + r)/2 is the same as Java's mid.
